CheckTitle: Default app management policy enforces credential restrictions on applications and service principals
Description: The default app management policy in Microsoft Entra ID enforces credential configurations on applications and service principals. When enabled, administrators can restrict weak credential types and enforce expiration policies.
Risk: Without an enabled app management policy, applications and service principals can be created with insecure credential configurations, including long-lived secrets or weak authentication methods, increasing the risk of credential compromise and unauthorized access.

Code.Other:
1. Navigate to the Microsoft Entra admin center (https://entra.microsoft.com/).
2. Go to Identity > Applications > App management policies.
3. Select the 'Default app management policy'.
4. Enable the policy and configure the desired restrictions for password credentials and key credentials.
5. Save the changes.

Recommendation.Text: Enable the default app management policy to enforce credential restrictions on applications and service principals, preventing the use of insecure credentials.

Notes: This check is equivalent to Maester test MT.1002. The default app management policy helps enforce secure credential practices across all applications in the tenant.
